articles.headline: In Ireland, Low Corporate Taxes Go Untouched
articles.snippet: Ireland plans to keep low rates that have attracted Microsoft, Intel and Pfizer but that other countries say distort competition.
articles.abstract: Ireland plans to keep low rates that have attracted Microsoft, Intel and Pfizer but that other countries say distort competition.
articles.lead_paragraph: DUBLIN — Cut Ireland’s minimum wage? Check. Collect more in property taxes from beleaguered homeowners? Check. Raise the corporate tax rate, which could plug the gaping hole in Ireland’s tattered balance sheets even faster? Well, no.

articles.headline: Germany Makes Gain on Bailouts
articles.snippet: Germany seemed to win qualified support from France in its effort to make private investors pick up part of the tab.
articles.abstract: Germany seemed to win qualified support from France in its effort to make private investors pick up part of the tab.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Undeterred by the deepening crisis over the euro, Germany stuck to its guns on Thursday in pushing to make private investors pick up part of the bill in any future bailout — and appeared to win support from France.
articles.byline: By Stephen Castle and Matthew Saltmarsh

articles.headline: Gold Fever: Pondering the Causes
articles.snippet: Investors turn to gold when they fear the return of big inflation and as a way to stick out their tongues at the so-called elites who run the economy.
articles.abstract: Investors turn to gold when they fear the return of big inflation and as a way to stick out their tongues at the so-called elites who run the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is part religion, part politics. It is a way to voice a lack of confidence in the central banks of the world and a yearning for the world as it used to be.

articles.headline: In Los Angeles, Big Step Ahead for Mass Transit
articles.snippet: The auto-obsessed city has embarked on the biggest expansion of its mass transit system in decades.
articles.abstract: The auto-obsessed city has embarked on the biggest expansion of its mass transit system in decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  This auto-obsessed city  a place where people love their cars almost as much as they hate the traffic  has embarked on the biggest expansion of its mass transit system in decades, an effort to change the way people navigate its sprawling and clogged streets and freeways.

articles.headline: Family’s Fall From Affluence Is Swift and Hard
articles.snippet: A $14 million windfall was lost to extravagant spending and the recession in little more than a decade.
articles.abstract: A $14 million windfall was lost to extravagant spending and the recession in little more than a decade.
articles.lead_paragraph: WAMEGO, Kan.  Grateful to have found work in this tough economy, Nick Martin teaches grape growing and winemaking each Saturday to a class of seven students in a simple metal building here at a satellite campus of Highland Community College.

articles.headline: For Retailers, Black Friday Expectations Are High
articles.snippet: Analysts say discounts and eager shoppers could result in the beginning of a strong holiday season for retailers.
articles.abstract: Analysts say discounts and eager shoppers could result in the beginning of a strong holiday season for retailers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Buy more, save more seems to be the mantra going into the holiday shopping season.

articles.headline: G.O.P. and Tea Party Are Mixed Blessing for Israel
articles.snippet: Fresh Republican support for the Israeli government after the U.S. midterm elections may be offset by Tea Party suspicion of foreign aid.
articles.abstract: Fresh Republican support for the Israeli government after the U.S. midterm elections may be offset by Tea Party suspicion of foreign aid.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel came to the United States recently for another round of tense talks with the Obama administration, he got a decidedly warmer welcome from one of the rising Republican stars on Capitol Hill, Representative Eric Cantor, the incoming majority leader of the House.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Jennifer Steinhauer

articles.headline: Shoppers Flock Back to the Mall to Hunt Deals
articles.snippet: On this year’s Black Friday, retailers and analysts said they saw a surge in traffic at stores over last year.
articles.abstract: On this year’s Black Friday, retailers and analysts said they saw a surge in traffic at stores over last year.

articles.headline: Europeans Striving to Calm Nerves in Markets
articles.snippet: Officials scrambled to speed measures aimed at easing the fears of nervous lenders as borrowing costs in the euro zone’s frailer countries flirted with new highs.
articles.abstract: Officials scrambled to speed measures aimed at easing the fears of nervous lenders as borrowing costs in the euro zone’s frailer countries flirted with new highs.
articles.lead_paragraph: MADRID  Officials across Europe scrambled on Friday to speed measures aimed at easing the fears of investors even as borrowing costs flirted with new highs in the euro zone’s frailer countries.
